website_summaries.verdict: Memory foam provides the comfort, a plush cotton lining provides the insulation, and a rubber sole provides the support. A great indoor or outdoor house slipper at an affordable price point.
pros: Firm sole, can be worn outdoors
cons: Soles are noisy on hardwood flooring
Memory foam is slow to recover

customer_reviews.title: Size-challenged, wearer beware
customer_reviews.text: Slippers themselves are fine. I'm happy with them except that reading the reviews about sizing convinced me to order larger than my size. I'm 10.5 -11 so I ordered 11-12 and they _just_ fit with nothing to spare. If I wear socks the size is a hair small but acceptable. And they make a nice old-man flopping and shuffling sound as befits someone of my station. Our grown kids laugh as I trudge along. Why did I come into this room?
customer_reviews.author: evan1138

customer_reviews.title: Stitching broke after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: I wore them for 1 week (only inside the house). The stitching came undone. The sole is now separating from the top. For what it's worth, they are super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TommyC

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these slippers for less than a week and the toe and heel parts are flat as paper now... also I weigh 180lbs if you want to factor that in. They seem cheap all around and I would not recommend this product to friends or family.
customer_reviews.author: ZR

customer_reviews.title: makes you feel like your walking on socks that have slid down and ...
customer_reviews.text: I never could understand concept of memory foam? Foam that completely collapses to nothing when pressure applied, This is my first and last experience with memory foam. These slippers, with memory foam interior sole cushion , makes you feel like your walking on socks that have slid down and then bunched up at the bottom of this slipper....kind of real Lumpy ...not like your walking on ROCKS...but still not in a good way. If it just had a good FIRM cushion inner sole, would be nice slipper. Order one size larger that chart suggested if your going to wear socks, at first did fit OK, but as slipper stretches I assume will feel sloppy...Will up date. The search goes on
customer_reviews.author: the Critic

customer_reviews.title: Great slippers, if they didn't fall apart in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these slippers for my 12 year old son for Christmas to wear around the house because we have hardwood floors. He loves them! They are great slippers and fit him nicely. The one star is because after less than a single month of around the house use, one of the slippers is falling apart. I would change my rating to five stars if the seller sent us a replacement, but I'm not sure how to contact them. The pictures show that they are otherwise in very good shape and barely used.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei

customer_reviews.title: You will not find a better slipper for your money!!
customer_reviews.text: I was born to wear these slippers! I end up buying new slippers every year because I am aways dissapointed by the poor quality of a promising purchase. However these slippers are pimp. I wear a 10.5 and on the recommendation of reviewers I bought a size 11-12. They couldnt fit better. Thank you Rock Dove for making my feet feel like millionares!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Good for a few weeks before falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these slippers to cope with post surgery foot pain from having two disks removed in my back. They were worn daily whenever walking around for the last 5 months. The memory foam failed and became compressed after two months and in a few more the sole split. Slippers should last more than 5 months before becoming trash.
customer_reviews.author: Name isn't important

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient memory foam padding, not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend and although they were comfortable at first, they are now completely flat in the heel area and do not provide sufficient cushioning there anymore. It has only been 4 months that he's used them, so I'm disappointed in the durability of the memory foam in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Manaka

customer_reviews.title: AVOID
customer_reviews.text: 4 STARS SIZE RUNS A BIT SMALL FOR ME-THIS WAS MY ORIGINAL REVIEW/AFTER 2 WEEKS I NOTICED HOW POORLY THESE SLIPPERS WERE SEWN/ AFTER 3 WEEKS LOOSE THREADS UP THE WAZOO/AFTER A MONTH THE SOLE BEGAN TO SEPARATE FROM THE UPPER. POOR MATERIALS/SHODDY CONSTRUCTION/DON'T WASTE YOUR $$$$$
customer_reviews.author: JZC

customer_reviews.title: Ugh...if you want to sound like a horse clattering across cobblestones...buy these.
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning these. I found them to be unacceptably loud. And no really that comfortable. What is that in the sole? Wood? Ugh. Rarely do I have such a negative reaction to an Amazon product with such good ratings. Oh well. I have another one coming up with some very uncomfortable shoe inserts. Thought I could depend on the reviews...not in this case. I imagine this review may be deleted after I return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Faja4x

customer_reviews.title: DISGUSTING MOLD IN SHOES
customer_reviews.text: I bought these slippers for my son. I was so taken aback at the complete lack of quality checking at AMAZON. These should never have been boxed. It was so obvious there was something wrong when you looked at the clear packaging as black mold was on the cardboard insert.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lobster

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Decent Fit, and doesn't get SUPER hot like many other slippers in the past, but it does have some weird ergonomics, that kind of irritate the arch in my foot (which may be because i have super flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Grindzilla

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and I cautioned him to order a size up, since that's always what we've had to do with slippers. I wouldn't recommend you do that with these. He normally wears an 8.5 and the sizing increments for this were 7-8 and 9-10. I told him to get the 9-10 and they're a bit big. He should have ordered a 7-8. Other than that, they're perfect!
customer_reviews.author: A. NicholsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: In The End, A Great Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: These slippers were a little tight to begin with, but stretched out as I wore them - they eventually became slightly larger than needed. The insoles were like walking on a pillow - very comfortable. Unfortunately, I began noticing small black pieces of something on the floor and I couldn't figure out where they were coming from until I saw the bottom of both slippers (see picture). What seemed like a great sole lasted only five months of indoor wear. What started out great was, in the end, a great disappointment and a poor investment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Riker

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable (thank you memory foam) but somewhat larger than expected. I wear a size 10 1/2 in sneakers, and a size 10 in dress shoes - both with. This is a size 9-10 and I have about a half inch of heel room. Not a big deal for slippers but worth noting. I'd be hesitant to try the next size down, 7-8. Also not specific to these slippers but many slippers out there in general - I'd prefer a heel backing rather than the clog format. I just feel more snug and cozy that way, and they are less slip-offy, so to speak.
customer_reviews.author: sifelaver

customer_reviews.title: Are these only supposed to last three months?
customer_reviews.text: It began quite nicely: nifty design, snug, cozy slippers. However, the honeymoon is over. The memory foam has, as many have mentioned in other reviews, collapsed. As I am not stout, this was disappointing. More disappointing, though, was the large fracture that developed in the plastic sole - while my photo nicely shows the big gash, what it doesn't show as well is the consistent cracking of the plastic around the edge around almost the entire slipper. Almost as though the plastic wasn't tested to hold up to daily use (maybe an hour per day). If this had happened one year in I would say I got my money's worth. In this case I cannot.
customer_reviews.author: WickedVerve

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy, excellent memory foam slippers.
customer_reviews.text: After doing the usual looking around, I opted for these. I am happy to say they have been excellent so far for me. As soon as I get home from work, I get out of my work shoes & pop these on. So I wear them for a couple hours or more a day. They have been holding up perfectly. They are very comfy. The memory foam has not given up on me at all, which from other reviews, had me worried. I wear these with socks on & without. Haven't had any issues either way. The slippers wi) keep your toes warm, if that's your thing. I definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Ireview4U

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long days at the house in quarantine
customer_reviews.text: Given the abundance of time I spend around the house in a COVID quarantine world, I needed a nice pair of house slippers. I have spent the last week wearing these 12- 16 hours a day and I have to say they are quite comfortable, keep my feet warm (but not too warm), and fit great. Overall a great value and I am very happy with my purchase. My old slippers built up a lot of static electricity on the carpet - so much that I was always shocking myself. These do not have that problem (must be something with the sole material, but nothing has shocked me yet!). So that is a huge plus for these.
customer_reviews.author: Points Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: These run a bit small for sure. That wasnt the only the thing I wasnt happy about. They were only worn a few times (with socks!) but really quickly started to smell. They didnt really smell the way you would expect stinky shoes to smell, it was really strange. I was pleased with being able to just throw them in the washer and get rid of it. Unfortunately, it came back again. On top of that, they were just generally uncomfortable. Would not buy again. I bought them to be disposable, so in that respect they worked perfectly, other than that they were kind of merp
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Size 13-14 is too small for a size 14 foot
customer_reviews.text: The 13-14 size slippers are too small for 14 size feet. Otherwise they are very nice slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful

customer_reviews.title: If you’re on the latter size, go a size up.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son, he just received them 3 days ago. This is a little early to give a TRUE review. He is almost 16 and loves them. His shoe size is 8, so I had a hard time choosing which size to purchase. A whole shoe size is a big difference, which way do you go??? I purchased the 9-10 size, the slippers are a little big, but much better than too small!!! I hope this helps when you’re choosing the size.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Tesch

customer_reviews.title: These would be perfect except they state indoor and that's fine
customer_reviews.text: These would be perfect except they state indoor and that's fine, if you have carpet... scuff marks galore... non-mark soles should be "Good Indoor Shoe Quality 101". These are sadly going back.
customer_reviews.author: Antoine L miller

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband who works 12 hour days and comes home exhausted. I did a bit of looking around for some nice comfortable slippers. I came across these and figured I'd give them a try. I was too excited to have him try them out. So far, He hasn't taken them off tonight. He said they are super comfortable. I asked how many stars, he said twenty, then asked me if that was an option. Haha. I tried them on myself and he was right. I think in the future I will try this brand again. Thanks Rock Dove!
customer_reviews.author: Mwillhoite

customer_reviews.title: Overall a Great Warm Product for your Feet!
customer_reviews.text: So I normally wear an 11.5 and purchased the 11-12 size. These just fit my foot at 11 and a half. I would recommend anyone that normally gets a 12 to go a size higher. With that said though these slippers are pretty great. The memory foam feeling is comfortable and the material is soft and keeps my feet warm. I’m particularly fond of the design and color (dark gray and blue) not sure why but i love it. These are some great slippers and I definitely recommend them. Used them as soon as I unboxed them this cold weather lately in FL was killing my feet when I let my dog out!
customer_reviews.author: Sentin3l

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable slippers I have ever owned. Plus they are washable. I was concerned when reviewers said to go up a size. I wear size 14 wide and 13/14 was the largest size offered, so I could not go up a size. Fortunately, they fit perfectly. During the winter I tend to wear slippers whenever I am at home because they are so much more comfortable than shoes. After a few days my old slippers would feel sweaty and gross. So, I bought two pairs of these washable slippers and I switch them every few hours. Plus I wash them a few times a week. Very nice and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: Does not have memory foam feel
customer_reviews.text: Definitely does not have memory foam but a very light weight soft foam. very comfortable at first but not high quality. Definitely not worth the price. I would not purchase or recommend to anyone. I do not think they will last more than a month. It is only been 3 days since I've bought them and I am unimpressed. Although they look nice in are comfortable at first. Until after about a week when they start wearing quickly and the foam flattens out. Then it feels like you're walking on a hard floor.
customer_reviews.author: bstncld

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit and Well Made. Comfy Cozy.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these slippers. After 2 months of use the slippers show no signs of wear. They look brand new. Size 11-12 D(M) fits me perfectly with socks. My normal shoe size is 11W. At first the slippers were a bit snug with socks (not too tight though). Within a week they stretched a little and are very comfy. Well Made. Durable plastic sole. Terry cloth liner helps keep the slipper on my foot. Memory foam is comfy and holding up well. Not flattening out. Breathable. Feet stay warm but don't get sweaty. I highly recommend these slippers.
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Sole
customer_reviews.text: I bought these slippers, and really enjoyed them for a while. However, the rubber sole deteriorated around the edges after less than 2 years of normal use, and now the slipper flaps at the toe and is a trip hazard. Next time, I'll spend 20 bucks more and get a good quality pair. I'm very disappointed with this purchase... because I've had a similar 10 dollar pair that lasted twice as long. The only reason I didn't rate it one star, is because they were warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: C.W. Jr

customer_reviews.title: these are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE SLIPPERS! They are comfy, nice looking and have really held up. I am pretty hard on slippers, and thse have kept their integrity very well. They are nice and warm, but not to the point of sweaty feet. The fabric is breathable. The feel is the perfect combination of cushion and support. Highly recommend you buy these! Ive had them for 4 months and they are still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Tigermomma

customer_reviews.title: Good slipper for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: After about a week of wearing these, they're about what I expected. I work from home so I've been living in these day and night, so they've gotten some miles on them already. The padding is decent. It will definitely flatten out relatively quick, but so have ones I've paid much more for. It has a decent depth of padding though. Solid sole. The seems have held up with lots of inside and outside wearing. For the price, it's a good slipper.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Good slipper for the guys
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband who wears a 10 to 10 1⁄2 in shoes and boots. They are wide through the toe and up to the ankle which he said is comfortable but they are a little long. He doesn't mind since he can wear heavier socks with them in winter. Since he does have a problem with foot sweat and stinky, he's now putting them on right away when he gets home and its easier than having to wash his feet and change into new socks so we both really like that part! Overall a good mens slipper.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Listen more to negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: I disliked this product , not as advertised. They are very loose fitting, even in your correct size and with zero support. The memory foam is only comfortable for the first few minutes then flattens out. It felt like I was walking on a flat surface with no support. I would not recommend walking outside due to slipper sole being very thin and you feel everything you walk on. I do not recommend this product. I would have returned the product if I hadn't walked outside in the slipper and got it dirty. Very dissatisfied for the money spent, I felt the product did not live up to the description.
customer_reviews.author: A.cook

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but get the size right
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are comfy as heck and will appeal to almost anyone. They're easy slip on or off and have just enough grip on the floor to avoid that fall we all fear. The only problem with mine was the size. I had gotten slippers my size from another vendor and they were too small, so I upped the size for these and now had ones too large. Apparently these size true to form, unlike most others, and thus if you do as most people do and get the next size up in order to be comfortable (width-wise) you will have loose fitting slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Beantown Jim

customer_reviews.title: Slippers, they're not just for indoors anymore
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of these guys that tends to wear slippers outdoors because I'm too lazy to put shoes on. I have beat the heck out of these and they're still holding up pretty well (8 out of 10). I've split firewood in them (yes, not smart), opened my pool for the summer, do yard work, etc and they still look pretty good. Don't expect to pick up the ladies in these bad boys, but if you want a durable product, they're not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmahmonkey

customer_reviews.title: I liked them until...
customer_reviews.text: I liked these until I had to wash them. I tossed them in the washer, by themselves, on cold and the gentle cycle then air-dried them as the instructions said. When I put them back on the memory foam had become unattached from the sole and bunched up in the most uncomfortable ways. I thought maybe I could just wear them for a day or two and it would spread back out and lay flat again, nope. I had to throw them away because after a couple of days of wear my feet were sore and walking in them was actually a little painful. Maybe someone else had a different experience washing them but that is my story.
customer_reviews.author: K. W. Queen

customer_reviews.title: Foam loses memory after minimal wear.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for less than a month, and only wear them occasionally some evenings, about 3 or 4 days a week. They were very comfy when just arrived, but now the memory foam is almost gone at the heel and they feel very flat. I’m 5'6" with slim build, so it's not like the product has been overly stressed. Most likely the foam is either too thin, or doesn't keep its form due to poor quality. On the outside they look great and the exterior materials appear of good quality, but it’s the stuff inside that matters for a slipper to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CA Dude

customer_reviews.title: keep feet off a cold floor
customer_reviews.text: for slippers there pretty ok...originally got the smaller size (12) I thought that they were a bit small especially when wearing socks ...returned them for a size 13 and these seemed to fit better ...but a tad big, fine when wearing socks...no complaints...I think everyone wants the perfect fit slipper or shoe but these are warm and don't slip off my feet even when they are just a splash too large...
customer_reviews.author: bobby b

customer_reviews.title: If you can't get the size you need don't order up or down,
customer_reviews.text: I needed the only size they don't offer 10-11. I tried the one below and the one above, they did not fit because they were not supposed to. If you can't get the size you need don't order up or down, they don't work unless they are the correct size. I did not send my second pair back because i felt guilty for sending the 1st pair back. Maybe I will find someone with 9-10 feet for Christmas. Update: They were small when I purchased them. less than a month later they are too big to wear, they just fall off. I will be throwing them in the trash. Bummer, they wee comfortable while sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Slomchinski

customer_reviews.title: Not quite right ...
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are attractive and feel warm and cozy on the foot. However, the lack “support”, not from the slipper to the foot, but in the structure of the item itself. They are so wonderful when you sit still wearing them, and they fit the foot nucely, but when you walk with them, stop to pick up something, or kneel to reach underneath a cabinet, it lacks a firmness which holds it in place on the foot. I’m keeping them for lounging when I don’t need to be active in any other way, but if the wearer plans to be active around the house in any way, I would not recommend this slipper to them.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley Murray

customer_reviews.title: Helps with pain
customer_reviews.text: I am a disabled veteran and my body is always in pain. My feet are always sore so I am always looking for slippers/shoes to help with pain. I bought the first pair because it was somewhat affordable, and ended up getting a second pair of these, one for in the house and one to wear outside. It doesn’t eliminate all of my pain but it definitely makes walking more bearable. Since I got these shoes I can tell a difference when I don’t have them on. My feet, legs and hips hurt more when I don’t have these on. I haven’t needed to clean or wash them yet, so I don’t know how well it stays together after that.
customer_reviews.author: James Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Almost a year on these and they haven't fallen apart. The memory foam is starting to lose some of its bounce and the spot where the dog decided it was a chew toy really hasn't made a difference in just a good house shoe that I wear way too much. I'm rough on slip on's and I have not treated these any different and they are still slidin across the kitchen floor for my morning coffee.
customer_reviews.author: DKH

customer_reviews.title: The good: they're stylish. The bad: everything else about them.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the flimsy plastic big these slippers were not as advertised. Too small. Badly fitting. And they fall off your feet. My Walmart slippers are more functional than these. Sending them back. Not a good product, IMHO. Note to Amazon: Why are you cramming everything I order into one large box?! Especially when one of the items is heavy. My order today had a heavy box of paper in with several smaller, more delicate items. Some were wedged under the heavier box and the tape on the box had nearly torn off. Fortunately everything made it, but smaller items could have easily fallen out of the gap in the top of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but fit and cushion, not exceptable
customer_reviews.text: These were bought to help cushion my feet while around the house due to plantar fasciitis and to slip into when getting up in the middle of the night... While I loved the color, have size 11 feet, they fit perfect in length but were so sloppy, my feet kept slipping out and sliding around in them, causing instability while walking. Also the memory foam, did not seem thick enough to truly cushion my heals. With that said, they had to be returned and look for another brand... If you have wide feet, with high arches on the top end of foot, they may work great!
customer_reviews.author: James Myers

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied considering price and my use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. Good choice considering the price and my use. I prefer to purchase a new pair every year so I do not invest much in my slippers. I wear them about 14 to 21 hours per week for trips outside, to the basement, and moving around the house when I am not wearing socks. They do run small. I wear a 14D and cannot wear socks with these slippers in a size 13-14. Not a problem for me since my feet get hot if I have socks on while wearing slippers. The slippers have a memory foam foot bed so they are cushy but not much in the way of arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Packman

customer_reviews.title: You get less than what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: For the price don't expect much. I've had them for about a month and wear them every night The "memory foam" collapsed in 2 weeks but the sole has good grip. The length is true to size but the width is wider. I wear a wide short and my feet don't touch the sides. The first 2 weeks they were comfortable but now they just feel like a floppy mess with a hard insole. Save your money and good buy a pair or just get Crocs for wearing around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not all that
customer_reviews.text: Solid 3. The memory foam doesn't provide as much support as I like. The reviews are what made me purchase this product. I was hoping for a little more cushion. They are warm and will suffice for their intent, which is just something to use indoors. I like the blue/yellow color scheme. My next indoor footwear is just probably going to be a pair of Rockport something or others from a store where I can try before buying. Wearing shoes outside then inside is disgusting and I need support for indoors as well.
customer_reviews.author: scoremaster

customer_reviews.title: Comfy & cute gift idea!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my father for Father’s Day; he turned 40 in March and he’s always been something of an “old man”. (Of course, this is a trait I adore about him). He tends to buy cheap shoes, and I’m the one that ends up purchasing him higher quality material. For example, he didn’t really have “in-house slippers”. I figured he’d like these; he has a sensitive back and these are memory foam slippers, which should treat him well. He doesn’t like walking barefoot, so he wears socks a lot. I thought he would enjoy having a pair of slippers he can lounge in and never take off. Sure enough, he wears these ALL the time! Such great slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Jaden LaBrake

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after my other branded slippers just were plain worn out inside. So, after looking around for a few days reading reviews and looking I settled on these. I found them to initially be well made (might change my review in six months), very, very comfy and warm. I like the look, feel, fitment and they are comfy which is something you need after a long day of working. They do not offer a heel as this would make them even better. But, good for around the house. I wouldn't wear them outside. I will revisit this review in six months...
customer_reviews.author: William Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE TO 5 STAR: I recently discovered the lumps I complained of were not in the slipper but the fault is my feet. Accordingly, the sole issue is size 12 a bit too snug for me. FORMER REVIEW (in err regarding "hard spots") I was surprised instead of foam I could feel uncomfortable hard spots in the sole. Plus size 11-12 was snug for my size 12 feet. I almost returned them, but they keep my feet warm, so merely posted my review. Customer service contacted me! They gave me a replacement pair! The lumps are less noticeable. The largest size is roomy for my size 12 feet. Best customer service ever!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had ordered up two sizes
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 10.5 or 11 show, depending on brand. I went with the 11-12 and now wish I had chosen the 13-14. These are very narrow and, while i think they may stretch a bit with wear, they are very tight with a lightweight ankle sock on. Upon leaving this review I see the price is now 16.99, even cheaper than the 19.99 I paid the other day. Go ahead and grab a pair of these, but order big, you'll appreciate the room. I may just order a 13-14 and give these to my kid. They feel comfy, but I wonder how long the memory foam will hold up. Time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Snug as a Bug
customer_reviews.text: I wear a regular 10.5" shoe, bought the 11-12 size, 13-14 seemed like it would be way too big. Slipper fits OK but a bit snug. I usually wear slippers with socks on and like a little room in the slipper, this is why i want to try them on first. For whatever reason where I live its hard to find mens slippers in the summertime so i decided to buy online. I I have been working at home for years so I do wear slippers as my primary footwear most days and go through a pair about every 6 months. Im going to keep this pair but i probably wont buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not fall for marketing of this poor product
customer_reviews.text: It is too large It was supposed to be size 10(men) but it is more like 11.5. Memory foam is a joke. foot padding is so thin that it feels like wearing socks(albeit poorly fitting ones).Wearing it makes me feel that I am going to trip and fall even indoors.So, I am no longer wearing it . Return is also a problem since it cannot be returned like the usual Amazon products . Instead it has to brought to a local Kohl's store for packaging and shipping ,which unfortunately for me is a problem since that is a rather long commute. Amazon customers should avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected.. A big let down
customer_reviews.text: My honest review, had a lot of expectations from this slipper, but unfortunately they are not steady when you walk,makes a lot of noise and the heel part kinda folds.. Not comfortable at all. If you home is wooden or tiled, expect every member of the house to know where you going as these slippers are very noisy, especially waking up for nature's call. These can be designed well, hope they make changes to it..
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Product; 1-year Life Span
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable product but unfortunately my slippers only lasted a little over a year before the slipper soles began to disintegrate. I only wore them in doors in carpeted and non-carpeted flooring, never outside. My wife would yell at me because I kept wearing the slippers even after the sole began to shed and the crumbling pieces of sole looked like little bugs on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for these hard times!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of this relaxing shoes. I received and up now I am really satisfied with quality and confort. I asked for a 11 size (I use 10,5 in regular shoes). it fits perfectly !....the sole is soft but not slippy, this is important!. only a sugestion, not to wet the inner of the shoe because it could be bad for the foam inside and maybe affect the life of the product Color blue and grey looks fantastic. Just a week of regular use. I exactly don't know if it will last a razoneable time. For now, I recommend 100% this product
customer_reviews.author: Rolan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Cozy
customer_reviews.text: My old slippers were falling apart and I didn't get a new pair for Christmas. I had seen these on Amazon and decided to give them a try. As soon as they arrived I tried them on. They seemed a bit tight, but after 3 or 4 days they eased just enough and are a great fit. Now after a couple of weeks they are still very comfortable. The lining and the fill provide a nice warm cozy environment for my feet. After a full workday in dress shoes, it is so relaxing to get into these. They keep my feet warm on the cold winter nights, and provide a nice soft and cushioned space that just encourages relaxing.
customer_reviews.author: Reader and Cook

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t feel like enough cushion on the first day!
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed that on the very first day of using these slippers, they are not cushiony enough! At least for the first few days, they should feel like clouds on your feet. Not so. 25 bucks, and they can’t put more cushion in these pups? Come on. They fit fine. Size as expected. The lip in the back is soft, so I can’t feel it. Plenty of room for toes to wiggle around and they are warm, and good looking. They’re not horrible, but I know they will flatten out even more, as this is only the first day. So, for the price, that is very disappointing. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Stretched out too much to wear comfortably
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10 med EU 42 so that’s what I purchased. Unfortunately, these stretched out so much within a month that I cannot wear them now. I walk right out of them. Too late to return. I’m bummed because the material was soft and comfortable during first two weeks. Be sure to buy one size smaller than what you typically wear. They stretch out BIGtime! I wish I knew that before buying! They tell you this on an insert in the packaging. Should have said that in the Amazon description. If it was in small print, I sure didn’t see it!
customer_reviews.author: SoU Know

customer_reviews.title: Ok slippers
customer_reviews.text: not sure why these are so popular. The padding inside gets compressed very fast and your basically walking on just the rubber soles. They fit super loose and after 8 months of just in the house use for a few hours a day they are coming apart. They are OK slippers but really nothing special. Honestly for what they are they should be like $10-$13 range.
customer_reviews.author: shawn b.

customer_reviews.title: Wont Last
customer_reviews.text: First received the slippers as a gift. Love them. They fit great and were extremely comfortable. But after just about 2 weeks of wearing them, they started to develop ridges, like the soles were scrunching up, and there's nothing you can do to straighten them out. So I decided to give them another try, and I ordered a pair of my own. Exact same issue. I'm great for about a month, but then started to develop ridges on the Soles again. Every time you take a step, it's like part of the shoe is jagging at your sole. Will not order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Warning. Looks good, Amazon choice! But cushion and bottom of shoe is so super thin. I bought for my nephew, and didn't check. So I bought another size up (2 pairs). As soon as I put my feet in and stood--I can feel the floor, hard below. And I was so looking forward to nice cushy comfy house shoes. I'll go out and go into a shoe store now.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaS

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart with minimal use in 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: These were great before they deteriorated, I really liked them. They were my go-to initial internet date footwear! If they'd lasted even +6 months with regular use that'd have been fine. Unfortunately, I used this maybe twice a week for 5 months and the toe just fell apart. I probably just got a bad pair but this review is of the pair I received which was of poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: alcoholicjedi

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, comfy. Me likey. :-)
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today and have been wearing them since they arrived. They are very comfy, and even with the wool lining my feet aren't sweating (it's the beginning of summer here in CA). I specifically got these to wear around the house and out in the yard. I definitely recommend these. **Updated - 6/16/20: I had to change my review from 5 to 3 stars because of how quickly these slippers lose their shape. They go from fitting a comfortable snugness to very loose fitting VERY quickly. If I were to buy another pair I would definitely go down a size.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Cushiony! Great purchase for price
customer_reviews.text: Love the color, love the cushiony inside, like the rubber bottoms. Cozy slip on. Good for wearing around home and into garage. I do not wear slippers in public - the furthest I wear them is my driveway. These are warm enough for me but I do slip inside them a little. I think after I wear them longer than a day or two my feet will mold inside better, but the cushion is there!!! Arch support is moderate but not predominantly felt. I don’t have an issue with arches. If you do you should elect a more orthopedic style
customer_reviews.author: swilliams4life

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but not sized as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain about the quality and comfort of these slippers. They're great. However... I wear a size 13EE shoe, so I ordered the 13-14. The description says to order a size up if you're an EE, but 13-14 was the biggest they had, and I thought the 14 should give me the extra I needed. Unfortunately, it wasn't. With some difficulty, I can cram my foot into the slipper and get my toes to the front, however, my heal still hangs over the back of the slipper. So... they're both narrower and shorter than advertised. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Uvario

customer_reviews.title: Rockdove slipper
customer_reviews.text: The slippers are well made and have a stylish look. I am not normally a slipper wearer. I thought I would try these because of the reviews. The slippers were a perfect fit, but did feel strange on day 1. On day 2, the slippers were feeling pretty good and comfortable. Starting on day 3, I put the slippers on when I get up or come home from a job and do not take them off until I retire for the night. I love these slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Bingo Bill

customer_reviews.title: My memory foam is losing its mind
customer_reviews.text: These were great upon first wear. The memory foam provided a nice, comfortable support and were, overall, just what I wanted in some house slippers for old, painful feet. At four months, the memory foam has collapsed at the pressure points (especially at the heels, which is where I need it most). While they are due for a washing (cannot comment on how that will go), I have no idea how that will affect the foam. I have searched for how to restore memory foam but to no avail. If, after washing, the memory foam still shows signs of dementia, I cannot recommend them. Four months is not good enough for a 20 dollar pair of slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Narq

customer_reviews.title: sound good on paper
customer_reviews.text: these are attractive slippers. sound good on paper, but the foam under NON-removable inserts, is a weak foam. and because you can't remove the foam, you can't add or upgrade or correct the foam situation. if you do add an insert, they become too tight. very disappointed. as my usernamesorel slipper fan is still a good though expensive slipper. not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: big Sorel slipper fan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but too big.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable slipper, but much larger than indicated. Just walking around the house, these fall right off my feet. The width is the main problem. The length of the slipper is fine. If I ordered the smaller size, it would be too short. Too bad, because they feel great otherwise. They should have a more narrow option.
customer_reviews.author: Shane F

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Slippers
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable pair of slippers I have ever had. At first, when I received it it felt a tiny bit snug. Within a couple of days as I wore it it 'opened up 'and became the most comfortable pair of slippers I have ever had. I have been using it for a few months and it really feels 'at home ' I have a few more slippers which are collecting dust because this one is perfect.. One more thing: I thought these slippers will fall apart being so soft. It didn't . it may feel to be a but pricey. But it's not considering the comfort. After all, we're worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Vatche

customer_reviews.title: Memory I don't think so.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: The memory foam has Alzheimer's. The mini-heel is oddly positioned so as the slipper is truly a slipper, like in aslipper offa tha foota, constantly. I bought this as a black friday purchase being $12. Even that does not help the way I feel about this purchase. While they are still unworn, I am giving them to someone who thinks I like them but secretly I don't. If this review saves one person from wasting their money then it was worth the time and effort. Pros: I like the inside and outside colors. Delivery was fast.

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were delivered to my house December 19th, photo taken on the 30th. I only wore them on occasion and inside the house. Didn't expect them to last forever, but more than 11 days would've been cool. Spend your money elsewhere!!!
customer_reviews.author: fill

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably is a 10
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable slip ons. Nice cushion to them seem to be well made, had them about 2 weeks or so and very happy with them so far. Helps keep my toes warm when the floors are cold or while just lounging around. Also have nice rubber sole that could be used to go out to mail box etc, but I strictly use them indoors
customer_reviews.author: Farmerjo

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, but unsure heel counter (heel cloth material above sole)
customer_reviews.text: RockDove made a very comfortable slipper that can be a safety hazard (at least for me), as it was far too easy to step back out of the slipper because the heel counter (the part of the heel above the sole that's part of the upper) needs to be at least 2 inches tall and not the paltry 1 inch that they come with. It's far too easy to trip or fall wearing these slippers, especially if you are helping someone to stand or sit on a wheel chair at home. Would purchase again from RockDove IF/WHEN they make these slippers with a 2 inch tall heel counter.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Orr

customer_reviews.title: Soft, Sturdy Slippers
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the soft, smooth comfort of these slippers. It is a nice alternative to walking on cold linoleum. These slippers are like warm hugs gently caressing my feet with grace and ease. I do not plan to stray away from buying RockDove slippers. These are my standard and I am sticking with it. I was not compensated in any way for my review. I like to give open, honest and transparent feedback on products I like to try. I hope you found this review helpful. If so, please click the 'Helpful' button to let myself and others know it has helped you.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: I really love my RockDove slippers
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are really great. The memory foam is super comfortable. I wasn't sure about them being size 9/10, i typically wear a size 9, but they fit fine. I can't remember a pair of slippers I've liked this much and, at nearly 60 years old, I've had a few pairs of slippers! I'll buy another pair when the time comes again
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable after memory foam conforms to the feet!
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a new pair of slippers he can slip on to go out and close in the chickens at night, or head out to his man cave. At first he said they were a bit snug, with his heels right on the edge. But after wearing them for 2 days he said they're just right. He said that the memory foam has adjusted around his feet, ale now they're really comfortable. That really means something, as he has gout, so his big toe gets very swollen and painful. He's quite happy with his new slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Mind WandererTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very little memory foam
customer_reviews.text: So these house slippers aren’t bad. I don’t regret the purchase at least. However, they’re really lacking in the memory foam department. I have several pairs of house slippers that have memory foam from different brands around the same price point, and there’s just no comparison between them and this product. I have some cheap memory foam inserts I picked up at CVS for $10 and they’re easily twice as thick as what comes with these slippers... If you’re looking for comfort look elsewhere. If you just want some nice looking house slippers with some breathability, these should suffice.
customer_reviews.author: tosbanzaiTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Happy Anniversary slips!
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say a few words on our second anniversary (I think, you know I'm bad with dates honey): We've been together for (I think that) two years, and you're the first thing I see every morning, when I get out of bed. We've has breakfast and picked up the newspaper together all year round, with no complaints on either side. You support me, and comfort every step I take in the morning, and await me for when I come back from work. These two years have been great, and I know that we will be together for more, because you are a tough, durable slipper. With all my love, Stinky feet.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav

customer_reviews.title: Durability is not good
customer_reviews.text: These had the potential to be excellent. Great look. Great fit. Solid construction. Unfortunately the memory foam has essentially flattened in a week and doesn't come back. Maybe i got a dud I don't know. We have used memory foam mattresses for years. I'm 220 lbs so i think it's reasonable to assume they wouldn't be flat in a week. A denser foam material would fix this and make these excellent as everything else is top notch. I suspect this is where the cost cutting occurred. I'm not returning used slippers but i wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bckrupps37

customer_reviews.title: Quality of upper is good. Sole tore off in about 40 days.
customer_reviews.text: Got these with great expectations. LOVED them at the first go. Sadly, however, the 'pasting' just tore off within 40 days. And, I do not jog in these! Got them delivered to India by a friend from USA. Sad thing. Will use duct tape, maybe. Or ask the cobbler to do some justice. For this amount of money and their claim of being The Best, they should have lasted longer. This is the sad reality of our times. World's top brands don't last their worth a dime. That cost cutting/rationalisation behemoth has consumed that dog called Quality!
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Good slippers for a few months
customer_reviews.text: With like many other clothing items, these slippers can be considered temporary for about 4 - 6 months (depending on how much you wear them). The slippers are great for the first 2 - 3 months and after the 3rd month, the degradation of the slipper is definitely felt. The memory foam starts to sink in and pretty much non existent after sometime. The quality of the rubber sole and the outer shell remains in tact most of the the time. Overall it is a pretty good slipper however expect to replace them every ~5 - 6 months if you wear them consistently around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Randy S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Slippers!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, good quality so far. Got a size 13/14. A little narrow, but I am sure they will stretch out as I wear them. I have a high instep, (the top part of your foot from toes to ankle) and if you are looking for a slipper to be comfortable with that, this slipper isn't for you at all! I will either have to cut a slice on the top, or stuff it with a hot wet towel to try to stretch it out. Otherwise, if you have a "normal" foot, these are great!
customer_reviews.author: MikeeWikee

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly comfortable but I needed a size larger though
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with the way they looked in the Amazon store, saw all the great ratings, and slammed the buynow button. I can't say I'm 100% in love with the fit. I bought the size 11-12 slippers thinking that since I wear sizes 11, 12 and 13 (depending on the brand) these would fit. They do fit just enough that my heel mashes the back wall of the slipper. The only other complaint I have is that my toe box spreads so far when I step, it spreads the shoe out making my feet look marshmallowy. Great comfort all around. I'd buy another pair in a heartbeat, just a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not durable. Only buy for short-term, infrequent use.
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear slippers when at home, so that's at least a few hours every evening, and more on weekends. While these slippers look nice and were quite comfortable to start with, after only about 4 months, they're essentially worn out. The fabric on the inside of the slipper is starting to wear and develop holes, and the padding of the sole has now completely gone flat, leaving the slippers lumpy beneath the feet and less comfortable overall. If you wear these for a few hours once a week, they may be fine, but if you intend to use them regularly, expect to wear them out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Always hesitant buying clothes, shoes and slippers over internet. Lots of obvious reasons. However, these RockDove slippers are perfect fit. Like the looks and they are very comfortable. I have no hesitation recommending RockDove to friends or anyone interested in great pair of men's slippers. Of course true test will come in longevity. So we will see. Let me add that color selected is right on and the price for such a quality slipper is ideal. I am considering purchasing another pair as back up. Again I highly recommend these slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Comfortable and Seem Durable Too
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband back in April (5 months ago) and he's worn them pretty much every day. He said they are still comfortable and he likes the solid type soles so if he needs to go outside, he can just slip them on and go. His previous pair of slippers were a type of moc for indoor use only. When these wear out, I would have no hesitation on buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: K. McGee

customer_reviews.title: Instep way too high. Donating to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.text: They’re very nice-looking and comfortable, but the upper is way too high at the instep. Comfortable if I’m walking around on one level, but going up or down stairs they slip right off my foot, which is definitely a safety issue. I do not have flat feen, in fact I have a slightly higher than average instep. Shortly after I purchased them I got a message from the vendor asking how I liked them, and to contact them if I had any questions or problems. I responded that they slipped off my feet when using the stairs, and asked if I should exchange them for one size smaller. I did not receive a response.
customer_reviews.author: Pieter B

customer_reviews.title: Memory foam is made of poor quality material
customer_reviews.text: Memory foam is made from a poor quality material. It loses all cushioning effect within a couple of weeks and is of no benefit to your feet. It's like walking on a bare floor. Sizing and other aspects of the slipper are acceptable, just don't buy it believing the memory foam will last. Updated 6-20-19: The seller contacted me about the memory foam issues I had with this slipper. They were concerned about the problem I experienced and offered to send a replacement or another model. I received a different style of slipper from them and I'm very happy they took the time to help resolve the issue. Thanks seller!
customer_reviews.author: Lets Play

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my 2nd pair of these shoes. I sometimes suffer with plantar fasciitis so I need special foot support. I bought a pair of them last year but I pushed those shoes past their limits. I wore them for many hours, working around the apartment in them, standing in them, walking outside in them and sometimes even falling asleep in them in a chair. Although I've worn the h**l out of them, they are still pretty decent but they are not quite as spongy as they were originally. Therefore; I've got these new ones, but I'm still keeping the old ones. If you need winter comfort, I encourage you to buy these inexpensive delights!
customer_reviews.author: Laconfuso

customer_reviews.title: Soft! Comfy! AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: These were the first pair of slippers I have bought. All of my others were given to me through gifts. This pair far exceeded the competition. The quality, softness, appeal, and comfort is outstanding. It feels like sliding into a cloud and wraps gently around your foot. The slipper stays securely on your foot even going up stairs. The memory foam is great quality and seems like it will last. I highly recommend this pair and will definitely buy more for others.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable Slippers
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable slippers. I ordered size 13 - 14. Length wise their is about a 1/4 of space remaining in the heal. They are nice and wide. I can walk around the house easy enough in these slippers but climbing up stairs they try to fall off. The only minor issue I have is the tags inside the slippers are right in the seam of the sole and the top. You can tuck them under the insert or cut the off. I would definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Beavis

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a diabetic with foot neuropathy, so accommodating shoes are a must. These slippers have a comfortable inner foam that provides relief and comfort. They not only snug nicely around my feet, but also conform with enough room when my feet get swollen. Overall, these slippers provide support and stability for the needs of my diabetic feet.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Servin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these slippers for use when I'm traveling. They're very comfortable and keep my feet warm during cold weather season. The issue I have is that they're not durable at all. I have never worn them at home and I don't wear them during warm weather. So over three years I've worn them for one or two trips per year with indoor use 95% of the time. I noticed that both slippers are now falling apart. Pretty frustrating and not what I would have expected. The slippers I wear at home are older than this and don't show this type of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Stimpson

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!
customer_reviews.text: I like these, the only reason for the 4 stars is because after I have worn them for awhile and broke them in they are a little looser now and lost a little too much of its comfortablilty.
customer_reviews.author: BelStorms

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: The slippers fit well, I wear a wide size 12 shoe, I have learned to always order larger, I ordered size 13-14, fits like a shoe. As far as memory foam goes, anything with memory foam WILL Collapse and stay that way over time, get used to it or don't buy it. As long as the material inside stays intact, has some padding and are comfortable overall, run with it, these are not 100.00 slippers which do the same thing as these, only with fur inside, these are a good deal over all.
customer_reviews.author: ScottS

customer_reviews.title: Great, Warm, Affordable household shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very cozy - enjoy the slip on and slip off functionality although when you head outside it does leave your ankles susceptible to cold. Otherwise, I can walk to my mailbox in 5 degree weather no socks and feel fine. Grip is superb for a household shoe, which leaves you confident heading outside for short bouts. Seems to not hold odor (good thing) and hasn't depressed in comfort (inner foam/cotton padding has held up)
customer_reviews.author: Leon Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Too loose for a narrow foot
customer_reviews.text: These just wont stay on my feet unless I shuffle them along. They are super comfortable to wear but I guess having a narrow foot means they cant stay on. Going up and down stairs is part comedy and part disaster waiting to happen so now I just take them off before going up or down. I really tried to like them but after 6 months of trying they are heading to the bin.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lott

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to try something new & easy on-off BUT
customer_reviews.text: these 11-12 sized never stay on my 11E feet, they slip OFF, no matter what I do, even walk funny I usually have to order either 11W, 11E or 12 in slippers/moccasins in order to get a fit so was very surprised and not thinking it a good idea to try a smaller size by mail .... Otherwise, I might give these 5 stars, maybe -1 because the exterior material looks akin to corduroy and thinking wear/tear might not be that great
customer_reviews.author: tgiv

customer_reviews.title: Good slipper, size issue.
customer_reviews.text: The RockDove Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slipper is a good product, but not something I would look to buy again. I ordered a 13-14 sized slipper cuz I wear a 13 size shoe. If I push my foot all the way into the slipper until my toes feel tight and uncomfortable the fit is just okay. My feet have slipped out of them a few times, even though their video says they'll stay with you. So far they appear durable and haven't started to come apart yet. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K

product_meta.title: RockDove Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slipper
feature_bullets: Easy on/off clog style slipper with a secure heel collar
Waffle knit upper lets your foot breathe, keeping your slipper sweat and odor-free; machine washable for easy care

Memory foam insole molds to the contours of your foot for pillow soft comfort; pamper yourself after a long day at work, or that hard working husband or Dad in your life by giving his tired feet a well deserved rest
Sturdy rubber sole lets you step outside the house to grab the mail or walk the dog without switching shoes. Non-marking and noiseless on both tile and hardwood floors.

Product designed and quality inspected in the USA, with a 24/7 US-based support team ready to take care of all your after-sale needs. Note: when reading other customers' reviews, please prioritize more recent feedback as RockDove has made multiple updates to this product since its launch in early 2017, improving on both its longevity and sizing.
